resources.title: Tour 11 - Side Wind Pointed at 9 O'clock

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: If you use a club with a lot of backspin you can go straight on the green. Have your second bounce up towards the pin. Stay away from the bunker and the rough.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 268 534 L 244 226" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="268" cy="534" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="244" cy="226" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: Use 6 bars of backspin combined with 5 in left sidespin. Use the slope on the right side of the green and let it roll down to the pin. This way is probably your best chance at a hole in one.

levels.svg: <path d="M 268 534 L 261 218" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="268" cy="534" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="261" cy="218" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: Use 4 bars of backspin to bounce it right to the pin. Keep in mind that there's a big hump on the green which will make it hard to get the ball in the hole.

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: The fairway slopes from left to right so use left sidespin and a small amount of curl. Try to find the right pocket on the right side of the fairway. This approach will give you a shorter approach to the green. Bounce your second shot over the bunker. It's uphill to the green from there so it's important to not use that much backspin or you may find your ball falling back down into the bunker.

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: A similar approach to the Black Path but you can find the shorter pocket on the right side of the fairway. This means you'll absolutely need all the distance you can get out of your wood.

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: This is the way to play if you don't get tailwind. Place your drive up towards the bunker but you don't have to get close since you won't be able to reach the green with your second shot anyway. Place your second shot before the center fairway bunker to give yourself a chance to chip in for an eagle. Use the back of the green to roll your shot back down to the hole.

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: If you catch a tailwind use a Titan / Kingmaker / Berserker to bounce over the bunker. You NEED a lot of topspin on your driver. From the second fairway you can go directly onto the green. The approach shot will work best with The Guardian in your bag.

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: Use a long iron (or wood for Masters). Use 1 - 1.5 bars of backspin and 1 bar of sidespin if you get a left to right wind and no sidespin if you get a right to left wind. Stay away from the left side of the green as it will make your ball roll down and leave you with a tricky putt.

levels.svg: <path d="M 195 495 L 225 204" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="195" cy="495" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="225" cy="204" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: Only play this way with a headwind or straight sidewind. Otherwise you will be between clubs. Use a wood with a good amount of backspin.

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: Aim you drive just before the bunker on the right. Bounce it over with max topspin to the fairway. That will leave you with a short iron to the green. Keep in mind that the tree is in play by the second bunker on the left.

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: It's recommended to only play this way with sidewind or tailwind. Use topspin to let your drive fall over the cliff and roll down to the fairway. It may seem difficult but is easier than trying to keep it up on the top fairway. For you second shot you can bounce over the bunker or go to the right of the bunker.

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: This is a trickier way to play it. It's more common to play this way in Masters than from other tees. Bounce your drive in the rough with max topspin and let it roll down to the left. From there you can bounce it over the bunker in front of the green.

levels.name: Rookie

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: You'll have no problem reaching the green playing your teeshot to the right. Don't use max topspin on your drive. From there you will have to use a small amount of curl (more if the wind is right to left), max right sidespin and a few bars of backspin.

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: Take this path when you get wind that is to the left off the tee. Don't use too much left sidespin or you'll risk going into the rough. The second shot is a straight one bouncing over the bunker in front of the green.

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: Use a wood or long iron to go directly to the green. Be sure to use a club with a lot of backspin. That will let your ball ride the slope on the right side of the green and let it slide down to the pin. This isn't an option without enough backspin on your club.

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: This is a very tricky shot. Don't use any backspin since the fairway slopes severely from left to right. Let the ball bounce over to the green and it will fall down to the pin.

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: This is not an easy hole. Use a small amount of left curl and some left sidespin on your drive. Place your ball up as close to the end of the fairway as possible. It you go short you will NOT be able to reach the platform on your next shot. Bounce your second shot off the platform with 3 bars of backspin. Should be a good chance for an albatross.

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: This is a much trickier drive but if you succeed, you'll have a much easier second shot to the green. You need to avoid the rough and the bunker. Use 4 - 6 bars of topsin to bounce over or a little less with tailwind. Second shot is played the same way as the Black Path. Use the platform in front of the green.

resources.title: Tour 10 Shootout - Tailwind Pointed at 11 O'clock
Tour 8 Shootout - Strong Right to Left Wind
Tour 8 Shootout - Left to Right Wind Pointed at 130
Tour 8 Shootout - Left to Right Wind Pointed at 2 O'clock
Tour 8 Shootout - Right to Left Wind

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: A really tough Par 3 where many people will drop into the water. Just focus on getting your ball onto the green. With tailwind or sidewind you should use 4-5 bars of backspin. With headwind, you should use a MAX of 1 bar of backspin because when your ball hits the ground it will basically stop and bounce down into the creek. When adjusting for the wind, you NEED to adjust for around 15-20% more than you normally do due to the elevation change.

resources.title: Tour 10 - Hard Sidewind Tips and Tricks for Going at the Green

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: With a tailwind you will have a chance to go directly onto the green. It's risky though, since missing the bounce on the island will lead to the water. Avoid this way unless you have straight tailwind. Also avoid going really short on the green. You won't be able to reach with your putt.

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: Without a good tailwind this is the way to go. Simple, safe drive in the fairway will leave you with a long or short iron to the pin.

resources.title: Tour 10 - Tips for Going for the Island Hop

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: With tailwind or sidewind (or if you're not comfortable with the black path), use this approach. Use as much power and topspin as possible on your drive. You'll need to get as far as you can to be able to reach the green with your second shot. You'll want to put a wood with a lot of distance in your bag as well.

levels.name: Rookie

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: With sidewind or headwind you can aim at the beginning of the island. Use max backspin to make your ball stop before it hits the rough on the far side of the island. From there, you'll have a wood into the green. The second shot wind adjustment should be about 25-30% more due to the elevation change.

guides.name: Blue Path
guides.text: With a tailwind you can get more aggresive and use max topspin to bounce on the island and over to the next fairway. With a lot of tailwind and a lot of topspin, you may be able to get the ball to the green.

resources.title: Tour 10 - Strategy and Tips for Eagle

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: With sidewind or tailwind you will be able to reach the second fairway for your first bounce. Use max topspin and try to get as close as possible to the green. Be aware that OB is very close on either side.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 234 822 L 214 365" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 214 365 L 217 141" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="234" cy="822" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="214" cy="365" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="217" cy="141" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: With a headwind or difficult sidewind you'll need to bounce your drive on the first fairway over to the next. The fairway is a bit tricky and can take some weird bounces. You should be able to reach the green if you find the rough though.

resources.title: Tour 8 Shootout - Right to Left Wind at 10 O'clock
Tour 8 Shootout - Left to Right Wind Pointed at 3 O'clock
Tour 8 Shootout - Right to Left Wind
Tour 8 Shootout - Left to Right Wind

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: Going short or long on this one are both punished. The bunker sits in front and the green slopes front to back just beyond the pin. Use 3 bars of backspin from the second tee and no more than 0.5 bars of backspin from the first tee. Definitely an opportunity for a hole in one.

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: May seem like an easy Par 3 at first but the landing spot slopes from left to right so you need to straighten the ball with curl or some left sidespin. The green also slopes severely from left to right just to the right of the pin so stay left!

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: A pretty easy Par 4 where there's no danger of not making the green in two. Important thing is to at least leave yourself a good chance of SHIPPING it in.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 215 674 L 259 229" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 259 229 L 255 131" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 255 131 L 140 105" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="215" cy="674" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="259" cy="229" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="255" cy="131" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="140" cy="105" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: This is a tricky drive that can easily end up in the rough or bunker. With a tailwind you may be able to go directly over or you can bounce it with 1 bar of backspin. Use the island to bounce your next shot onto the green. You could use the right fairway for your second shot but it will require a massive curl with sidespin to pull it off.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 190 753 L 137 319" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 137 319 L 97 127" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 97 127 L 104 87" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="190" cy="753" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="137" cy="319" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="97" cy="127" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="104" cy="87" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: This is the safer and generally easier approach. Get as close to the end of the fairway as possible. You'll need to use some backspin on your drive because the fairway slopes down severely at the very end. That will leave you with a pretty straight shot into the green and a chance at an albatross.

resources.title: Tour 10 - Trick for Getting to the Green in 2 When Aimed OB

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: The best way to go as long as you have enough distance / wind to reach the green on your second shot. You'll need to place your drive as close to the end of the fairway as possible to have a chance. Land your second shot in the rough and have it roll out onto the green.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 237 800 L 285 298" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 285 298 L 164 74" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="237" cy="800" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="285" cy="298" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="164" cy="74" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: Without the needed tailwind on your second shot you'll have to lay up at the end of the second fairway. This should leave you with a short iron or wedge into the green.

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: Might be possible to go this way from the first tee but still a stretch to pull off. Playing this way from the back tees is borderline insanity.

resources.title: Tour 8 - 2nd Tee Shootout Wind Pointed at 730
Tour 8 - Shootout wind pointed at 4 O'clock
Tour 8 - 2nd Tee Shootout Wind Pointed at 8 O'clock
Tour 8 - 2nd Tee Strategy and Tips for Eagle
Tour 8 - 2nd Tee Strategy and Tips for Driving the Green

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: This is the typical way to play the hole unless you get good tailwind. Bounce over the bunker with some curl and max sidespin to the right. For the second shot a dunk is a very good option since the green will allow a missed dunk to fall back down to the hole for an easy putt.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 173 637 C 145 467 145 467 156 311" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 156 311 L 179 193" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 179 193 L 280 98" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="173" cy="637" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="156" cy="311" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="179" cy="193" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="280" cy="98" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 185 748 C 145 467 145 467 156 311" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 156 311 L 179 193" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 179 193 L 280 98" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="185" cy="748" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="156" cy="311" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="179" cy="193" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="280" cy="98" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: If you get a good tailwind you can go directly over the bunker and kill it as far as possible on the fairway. That will leave you with a short iron or a wedge for your second shot and an excellent opportunity for an eagle.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 173 637 C 116 435 116 435 183 159" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 183 159 L 274 89" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="173" cy="637" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="183" cy="159" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="274" cy="89" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

levels.svg: <path d="M 182 693 C 116 435 116 435 183 159" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 183 159 L 274 89" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="182" cy="693" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="183" cy="159" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="274" cy="89" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

levels.svg: <path d="M 185 748 C 116 435 116 435 183 159" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 183 159 L 274 89" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="185" cy="748" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="183" cy="159" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="274" cy="89" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: This is one of the easiest par 3's in the game. You can play this one in two different ways. One way is with the Guardian and max backspin directly onto the green. If you're playing from the first or third tee, you should try bouncing in between the bunkers. Use about 3 bars of backspin and it will give you a really good opportunity for a hole in one.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 155 506 L 158 211" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="155" cy="506" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="158" cy="211" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 151 589 L 158 211" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="151" cy="589" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="158" cy="211" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 149 664 L 158 211" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="149" cy="664" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="158" cy="211" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: Many times you won't be able to get to the second fairway with you drive so put your ball up as close to the rough on top as possible. If you go too short, you'll need to bounce before the rough on your second shot with max left sidespin combined with 4 bars of topspin. Apply a small amount of curl to the left.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 131 803 L 193 373" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 193 373 C 210 268 210 268 184 189" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="131" cy="803" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="193" cy="373" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="184" cy="189" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 130 856 L 193 373" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 193 373 C 210 268 210 268 184 189" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="130" cy="856" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="193" cy="373" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="184" cy="189" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 132 912 L 193 373" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 193 373 C 210 268 210 268 184 189" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="132" cy="912" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="193" cy="373" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="184" cy="189" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

guides.name: Blue Path
guides.text: Same drive as the black path but if you have a wood with more distance you can carry your second shot over the rough with 0.5 - 1 bars of topspin and max left sidespin. Apply curl to the left and that should get you close to the pin.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 131 803 L 180 371" stroke="blue" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 180 371 C 200 268 200 268 172 165" stroke="blue" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 172 165 L 155 122" stroke="blue" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="131" cy="803" r="6" fill="blue" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="180" cy="371" r="6" fill="blue" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="172" cy="165" r="6" fill="blue" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="155" cy="122" r="6" fill="blue" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 130 856 L 180 371" stroke="blue" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 180 371 C 200 268 200 268 172 165" stroke="blue" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 172 165 L 155 122" stroke="blue" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="130" cy="856" r="6" fill="blue" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="180" cy="371" r="6" fill="blue" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="172" cy="165" r="6" fill="blue" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="155" cy="122" r="6" fill="blue" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 132 912 L 180 371" stroke="blue" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 180 371 C 200 268 200 268 172 165" stroke="blue" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 172 165 L 155 122" stroke="blue" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="132" cy="912" r="6" fill="blue" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="180" cy="371" r="6" fill="blue" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="172" cy="165" r="6" fill="blue" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="155" cy="122" r="6" fill="blue" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: With tailwind on your drive you can bounce on the first fairway with max topspin and get down to the second fairway. From there, you'll have a long or short iron to the pin.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 131 803 L 200 379" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 200 379 L 220 294" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 220 294 L 163 114" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="131" cy="803" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="200" cy="379" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="220" cy="294" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="163" cy="114" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 130 856 L 200 379" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 200 379 L 220 294" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 220 294 L 163 114" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="130" cy="856" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="200" cy="379" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="220" cy="294" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="163" cy="114" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 132 912 L 200 379" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 200 379 L 220 294" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 220 294 L 163 114" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="132" cy="912" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="200" cy="379" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="220" cy="294" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="163" cy="114" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: This is a GREAT chance at a hole in one. Bounce right before the bunker and the green will feed the ball nicely down to the hole. From the front tee, don't use any spin and from the 2nd tee use 2 - 3 bars of backspin. You'll need to adjust with a small amount of curl if you get a sidewind more than 7 MPH (curl against the wind).

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 186 553 L 156 255" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="186" cy="553" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="156" cy="255" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 188 649 L 156 255" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="188" cy="649" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="156" cy="255" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 190 745 L 156 255" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="190" cy="745" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="156" cy="255" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: This is a very tough par 4. There's no room for mistakes whatsoever. The drive is the key. You need to bounce over the bunker on the left side or keep to the right of it. Use a wood with a good amount of curl on your second shot. You'll also want to use a ball with good sidespin. Use both curl and sidespin to land on the green. A birdie is a good score here. It's very hard to eagle.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 230 785 L 200 381" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 200 381 L 195 271" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 195 271 C 216 156 216 156 278 104" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="230" cy="785" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="200" cy="381" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="195" cy="271" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="278" cy="104" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 222 835 L 200 381" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 200 381 L 195 271" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 195 271 C 216 156 216 156 278 104" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="222" cy="835" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="200" cy="381" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="195" cy="271" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="278" cy="104" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 214 887 L 200 381" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 200 381 L 195 271" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 195 271 C 216 156 216 156 278 104" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="214" cy="887" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="200" cy="381" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="195" cy="271" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="278" cy="104" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: This is a hole where the drive is crucial. If you miss the fairway, you will NOT be able to reach the green in two. Be aware of the trees in the middle since they can easily give you a par or a bogey. Use max topspin and bounce near the beginning of the trees. For the second shot you will need a wood club with a good amount of curl. With tailwind use 4-5 bars of backspin and with headwind use 2-3 bars of backspin. Bounce over the creek and onto the green.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 197 804 C 163 591 163 591 210 391" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 210 391 L 227 314" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 227 314 C 237 251 237 251 223 155" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="197" cy="804" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="210" cy="391" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="227" cy="314" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="223" cy="155" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 191 853 C 163 591 163 591 210 391" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 210 391 L 227 314" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 227 314 C 237 251 237 251 223 155" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="191" cy="853" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="210" cy="391" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="227" cy="314" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="223" cy="155" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 185 903 C 163 591 163 591 210 391" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 210 391 L 227 314" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 227 314 C 237 251 237 251 223 155" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="185" cy="903" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="210" cy="391" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="227" cy="314" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="223" cy="155" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: With good side/tailwind you should be able to go on the right side, especially if you play form the first or second tees. Bounce your drive over the rough patch and you will have a much straighter second shot into the green and a good shot at an albatross.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 197 804 L 257 467" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 257 467 L 271 314" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 271 314 L 231 146" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="197" cy="804" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="257" cy="467" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="271" cy="314" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="231" cy="146" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 191 853 L 257 467" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 257 467 L 271 314" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 271 314 L 231 146" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="191" cy="853" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="257" cy="467" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="271" cy="314" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="231" cy="146" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 185 903 L 257 467" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 257 467 L 271 314" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 271 314 L 231 146" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="185" cy="903" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="257" cy="467" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="271" cy="314" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="231" cy="146" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: This is a tougher par 3 than it looks. Main approach is to go on the fairway in the front left corner of the green. From the first tee, you shouldn't use any backspin and only right sidespin. You can also use the rough beside the bunker to bounce it there using 2 bars of topspin. From the second tee, use the Guardian with max backspin and bounce it on the fairway in the same front left corner. That will give you an opportunity for a hole in one.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 192 617 C 156 426 156 426 188 283" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="192" cy="617" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="188" cy="283" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 188 698 C 156 426 156 426 188 283" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="188" cy="698" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="188" cy="283" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 185 780 C 156 426 156 426 188 283" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="185" cy="780" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="188" cy="283" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: If you don't want to play aggressively, you should go straight ahead with 4-6 bars of topspin, combined with a small amount of right curl. For the second shot, you NEED to have a club with a lot of backspin. The reason is that the sliver of fairway just before the green is uphill and will trick you, so avoid it. With a lot of backspin on your long or short iron you will be able to go directly onto the green (possibly with a dunk).

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 191 620 C 119 361 119 361 166 159" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 166 159 L 258 99" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="191" cy="620" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="166" cy="159" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="258" cy="99" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 202 669 C 119 361 119 361 166 159" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 166 159 L 258 99" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="202" cy="669" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="166" cy="159" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="258" cy="99" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 213 719 C 119 361 119 361 166 159" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 166 159 L 258 99" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="213" cy="719" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="166" cy="159" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="258" cy="99" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: With tailwind or side/tailwind to the right you can play this hole more aggressively. Apply a good amount of curl to the right along with max topspin and right sidespin. You'll want to get really close to the green for a second shot with a short iron or wedge. This will give you a good opportunity for an eagle.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 191 620 C 104 336 104 336 220 110" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 220 110 L 254 92" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="191" cy="620" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="220" cy="110" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="254" cy="92" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 202 669 C 104 336 104 336 220 110" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 220 110 L 254 92" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="202" cy="669" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="220" cy="110" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="254" cy="92" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 213 719 C 104 336 104 336 220 110" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 220 110 L 254 92" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="213" cy="719" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="220" cy="110" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="254" cy="92" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: No matter the wind, the drive is just trying to get as far down the fairway as possible. With enough tailwind you can get your second shot over to the second fairway on the left. With a good shot, topspin and right sidespin you should be able to get the ball to the green. Making an eagle on this hole is not easy.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 200 944 L 173 430" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 173 430 C 166 310 166 310 194 172" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 194 172 L 209 126" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="200" cy="944" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="173" cy="430" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="194" cy="172" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="209" cy="126" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 197 993 L 173 430" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 173 430 C 166 310 166 310 194 172" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 194 172 L 209 126" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="197" cy="993" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="173" cy="430" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="194" cy="172" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="209" cy="126" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 194 1041 L 173 430" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 173 430 C 166 310 166 310 194 172" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 194 172 L 209 126" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="194" cy="1041" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="173" cy="430" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="194" cy="172" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="209" cy="126" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: With headwind or sidewind, you won't be able to reach the second fairway with you second shot. In that case, keep playing up the right side and use a long iron with a good amount of backspin for your third shot. You can also use the rough just after the bunker and let your ball roll out to the pin.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 200 944 L 191 432" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 191 432 L 245 238" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 245 238 L 226 129" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="200" cy="944" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="191" cy="432" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="245" cy="238" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="226" cy="129" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

resources.title: Tour 8 Shootout - Left to Right Wind Pointed at 2 O`clock
Tour 8 Shootout - Left to Right Wind

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: This is a GREAT chance at a hole in one. Bounce right before the bunker and the green will feed the ball nicely down to the hole. From the front tee, don't use any spin and from the 2nd tee use 2 - 3 bars of backspin. You'll need to adjust with a small amount of curl if you get a sidewind more than 7 MPH (curl against the wind).

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 153 554 L 143 232" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="153" cy="554" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="143" cy="232" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 148 656 L 143 232" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="148" cy="656" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="143" cy="232" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 143 759 L 143 232" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="143" cy="759" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="143" cy="232" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: This is a very tough par 4. There's no room for mistakes whatsoever. The drive is the key. You need to bounce over the bunker on the left side or keep to the right of it. Use a wood with a good amount of curl on your second shot. You'll also want to use a ball with good sidespin. Use both curl and sidespin to land on the green. A birdie is a good score here. It's very hard to eagle.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 266 812 L 223 405" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 223 405 L 217 299" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 217 299 C 236 162 236 162 302 116" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="266" cy="812" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="223" cy="405" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="217" cy="299" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="302" cy="116" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 258 864 L 223 405" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 223 405 L 217 299" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 217 299 C 236 162 236 162 302 116" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="258" cy="864" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="223" cy="405" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="217" cy="299" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="302" cy="116" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 251 915 L 223 405" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 223 405 L 217 299" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 217 299 C 236 162 236 162 302 116" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="251" cy="915" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="223" cy="405" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="217" cy="299" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="302" cy="116" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: This is the typical way to play the hole unless you get good tailwind. Bounce over the bunker with some curl and max sidespin to the right. For the second shot a dunk is a very good option since the green will allow a missed dunk to fall back down to the hole for an easy putt.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 181 684 C 145 467 145 467 168 341" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 168 341 L 196 206" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 196 206 L 303 113" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="181" cy="684" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="168" cy="341" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="196" cy="206" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="303" cy="113" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 190 742 C 145 467 145 467 168 341" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 168 341 L 196 206" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 196 206 L 303 113" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="190" cy="742" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="168" cy="341" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="196" cy="206" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="303" cy="113" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 192 799 C 145 467 145 467 168 341" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 168 341 L 196 206" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 196 206 L 303 113" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="192" cy="799" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="168" cy="341" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="196" cy="206" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="303" cy="113" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: If you get a good tailwind you can go directly over the bunker and kill it as far as possible on the fairway. That will leave you with a short iron or a wedge for your second shot and an excellent opportunity for an eagle.

levels.name: Rookie

resources.title: Tour 8 - Strategy and Tips for Eagle

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: No matter the wind, the drive is just trying to get as far down the fairway as possible. With enough tailwind you can get your second shot over to the second fairway on the left. With a good shot, topspin and right sidespin you should be able to get the ball to the green. Making an eagle on this hole is not easy.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 194 868 L 150 413" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 150 413 C 131 301 131 301 154 163" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 154 163 L 164 112" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="194" cy="868" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="150" cy="413" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="154" cy="163" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="164" cy="112" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: With headwind or sidewind, you won't be able to reach the second fairway with you second shot. In that case, keep playing up the right side and use a long iron with a good amount of backspin for your third shot. You can also use the rough just after the bunker and let your ball roll out to the pin.

resources.title: Tour 8 Shootout - Hard Left to Right Wind
Tour 8 Shootout - Headwind Pointed at 5 O`clock
Tour 8 Shootout - Left to Right Wind

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: This is a tougher par 3 than it looks. Main approach is to go on the fairway in the front left corner of the green. From the first tee, you shouldn't use any backspin and only right sidespin. You can also use the rough beside the bunker to bounce it there using 2 bars of topspin. From the second tee, use the Guardian with max backspin and bounce it on the fairway in the same front left corner. That will give you an opportunity for a hole in one.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 177 585 C 119 417 119 417 151 256" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="177" cy="585" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="151" cy="256" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: Many times you won't be able to get to the second fairway with your driver so put your ball up as close to the rough on top as possible. If you go too short, you'll need to bounce before the rough on your second shot with max left sidespin combined with 4 bars of topspin. Apply a small amount of curl to the left.

guides.name: Blue Path
guides.text: Same drive as the black path but if you have a wood with more distance you can carry your second shot over the rough with 0.5 - 1 bars of topspin and max left sidespin. Apply curl to the left and that should get you close to the pin.

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: With tailwind on your drive you can bounce on the first fairway with max topspin and get down to the second fairway. From there, you'll have a long or short iron to the pin.

resources.title: Tour 8 - Tips for Backspin Eagle Shot
Tour 8 - Tips and Strategy for Eagle

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: If you don't want to play aggressively, you should go straight ahead with 4-6 bars of topspin, combined with a small amount of right curl. For the second shot, you NEED to have a club with a lot of backspin. The reason is that the sliver of fairway just before the green is uphill and will trick you, so avoid it. With a lot of backspin on your long or short iron you will be able to go directly onto the green (possibly with a dunk).

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 224 719 C 126 414 126 414 180 220" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 180 220 L 285 136" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="224" cy="719" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="180" cy="220" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="285" cy="136" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: With tailwind or side/tailwind to the right you can play this hole more aggressively. Apply a good amount of curl to the right along with max topspin and right sidespin. You'll want to get really close to the green for a second shot with a short iron or wedge. This will give you a good opportunity for an eagle.

resources.title: Tour 8 Shootout - Wind Pointed at 3 O`clock

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: This is one of the easiest par 3's in the game. You can play this one in two different ways. One way is with the Guardian and max backspin directly onto the green. If you're playing from the first or third tee, you should try bouncing in between the bunkers. Use about 3 bars of backspin and it will give you a really good opportunity for a hole in one.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 197 561 L 183 234" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="197" cy="561" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="183" cy="234" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 201 657 L 183 234" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="201" cy="657" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="183" cy="234" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 203 745 L 183 234" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="203" cy="745" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="183" cy="234" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: This is a hole where the drive is crucial. If you miss the fairway, you will NOT be able to reach the green in two. Be aware of the trees in the middle since they can easily give you a par or a bogey. Use max topspin and bounce near the beginning of the trees. For the second shot you will need a wood club with a good amount of curl. With tailwind use 4-5 bars of backspin and with headwind use 2-3 bars of backspin. Bounce over the creek and onto the green.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 202 837 C 161 549 161 549 196 417" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 196 417 L 208 343" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 208 343 C 210 251 210 251 195 159" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="202" cy="837" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="196" cy="417" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="208" cy="343" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="195" cy="159" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Pro

levels.name: Masters

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: With good side/tailwind you should be able to go on the right side, especially if you play form the first or second tees. Bounce your drive over the rough patch and you will have a much straighter second shot into the green and a good shot at an albatross.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 202 837 L 244 489" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 244 489 L 257 348" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 257 348 L 200 154" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="202" cy="837" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="244" cy="489" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="257" cy="348" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="200" cy="154" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 199 886 L 244 489" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 244 489 L 257 348" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 257 348 L 200 154" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="199" cy="886" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="244" cy="489" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="257" cy="348" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="200" cy="154" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 195 936 L 244 489" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 244 489 L 257 348" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 257 348 L 200 154" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="195" cy="936" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="244" cy="489" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="257" cy="348" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="200" cy="154" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: The best way to go as long as you have enough distance / wind to reach the green on your second shot. You'll need to place your drive as close to the end of the fairway as possible to have a chance. Land your second shot in the rough and have it roll out onto the green.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 178 901 L 294 368" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 294 368 L 185 98" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="178" cy="901" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="294" cy="368" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="185" cy="98" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 173 956 L 294 368" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 294 368 L 185 98" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="173" cy="956" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="294" cy="368" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="185" cy="98" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

levels.svg: <path d="M 167 1013 L 294 368" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 294 368 L 185 98" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="167" cy="1013" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="294" cy="368" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="185" cy="98" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

guides.name: Red Path
guides.text: Without the needed tailwind on your second shot you'll have to lay up at the end of the second fairway. This should leave you with a short iron or wedge into the green.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 178 901 L 305 376" stroke="red" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 305 376 L 251 172" stroke="red" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 251 172 L 202 78" stroke="red" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="178" cy="901" r="6" fill="red" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="305" cy="376" r="6" fill="red" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="251" cy="172" r="6" fill="red" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="202" cy="78" r="6" fill="red" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.svg: <path d="M 173 956 L 305 376" stroke="red" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 305 376 L 251 172" stroke="red" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 251 172 L 202 78" stroke="red" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="173" cy="956" r="6" fill="red" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="305" cy="376" r="6" fill="red" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="251" cy="172" r="6" fill="red" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="202" cy="78" r="6" fill="red" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />
