guides.name: White Path
guides.text: Might be possible to go this way from the first tee but still a stretch to pull off. Playing this way from the back tees is borderline insanity.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 178 901 L 214 476" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 214 476 L 237 339" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 237 339 L 188 99" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="178" cy="901" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="214" cy="476" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="237" cy="339" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="188" cy="99" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 173 956 L 214 476" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 214 476 L 237 339" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 237 339 L 188 99" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="173" cy="956" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="214" cy="476" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="237" cy="339" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="188" cy="99" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 167 1013 L 214 476" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 214 476 L 237 339" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 237 339 L 188 99" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="167" cy="1013" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="214" cy="476" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="237" cy="339" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="188" cy="99" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: May seem like an easy Par 3 at first but the landing spot slopes from left to right so you need to straighten the ball with curl or some left sidespin. The green also slopes severely from left to right just to the right of the pin so stay left!

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 200 531 L 194 199" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="200" cy="531" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="194" cy="199" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 179 623 L 194 199" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="179" cy="623" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="194" cy="199" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 158 719 L 194 199" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="158" cy="719" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="194" cy="199" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: With sidewind or tailwind you will be able to reach the second fairway for your first bounce. Use max topspin and try to get as close as possible to the green. Be aware that OB is very close on either side.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 105 738 L 108 296" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 108 296 L 124 108" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="105" cy="738" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="108" cy="296" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="124" cy="108" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 104 802 L 108 296" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 108 296 L 124 108" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="104" cy="802" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="108" cy="296" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="124" cy="108" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 103 867 L 108 296" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 108 296 L 124 108" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="103" cy="867" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="108" cy="296" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="124" cy="108" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: With a headwind or difficult sidewind you'll need to bounce your drive on the first fairway over to the next. The fairway is a bit tricky and can take some weird bounces. You should be able to reach the green if you find the rough though.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 105 738 C 144 483 144 483 125 373" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 125 373 L 111 299" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 111 299 L 118 106" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="105" cy="738" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="125" cy="373" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="111" cy="299" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="118" cy="106" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 104 802 C 144 483 144 483 125 373" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 125 373 L 111 299" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 111 299 L 118 106" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="104" cy="802" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="125" cy="373" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="111" cy="299" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="118" cy="106" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 103 867 C 144 483 144 483 125 373" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 125 373 L 111 299" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 111 299 L 118 106" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="103" cy="867" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="125" cy="373" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="111" cy="299" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="118" cy="106" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: Going short or long on this one are both punished. The bunker sits in front and the green slopes front to back just beyond the pin. Use 3 bars of backspin from the second tee and no more than 0.5 bars of backspin from the first tee. Definitely an opportunity for a hole in one.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 185 568 L 192 285" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 192 285 L 194 203" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="185" cy="568" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="192" cy="285" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="194" cy="203" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 185 686 L 192 285" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 192 285 L 194 203" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="185" cy="686" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="192" cy="285" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="194" cy="203" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 184 807 L 192 285" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 192 285 L 194 203" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="184" cy="807" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="192" cy="285" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="194" cy="203" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: With side or tail wind this is the preferred way to play. Max topspin and a wide fairway should leave you with a second shot to the green.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 415 789 L 183 299" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 183 299 L 406 110" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="415" cy="789" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="183" cy="299" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="406" cy="110" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 433 835 L 183 299" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 183 299 L 406 110" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="433" cy="835" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="183" cy="299" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="406" cy="110" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 444 887 L 183 299" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 183 299 L 406 110" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="444" cy="887" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="183" cy="299" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="406" cy="110" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: With a good tailwind you can bounce your drive on the island and hop over to the next fairway for a better chance at the albatross. With a stiff headwind that limits your distance on the left side, you can use about 4 bars of backspin and layup on the island fairway. Hitting your second shot from the island is way downhill so the wind will have a MUCH bigger effect on your ball.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 415 789 L 448 378" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 448 378 L 468 215" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 468 215 L 455 96" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="415" cy="789" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="448" cy="378" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="468" cy="215" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="455" cy="96" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 433 835 L 448 378" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 448 378 L 468 215" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 468 215 L 455 96" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="433" cy="835" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="448" cy="378" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="468" cy="215" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="455" cy="96" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 444 887 L 448 378" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 448 378 L 468 215" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 468 215 L 455 96" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="444" cy="887" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="448" cy="378" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="468" cy="215" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="455" cy="96" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: Many people will drop into the water on this one even if it looks like an easy hole. The wind will have a greater effect on your ball so adjust for about 20% more wind than you see. With a headwind you shouldn't use much backspin at all as the ball will basically stop when it hits the ground.

levels.name: Rookie

levels.svg: <path d="M 182 610 L 180 200" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 180 200 L 175 145" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="182" cy="610" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="180" cy="200" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="175" cy="145" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: A pretty easy Par 4 where there's no danger of not making the green in two. Important thing is to at least leave yourself a good chance of SHIPPING it in.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 153 728 L 255 260" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 255 260 L 259 147" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 259 147 L 134 112" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="153" cy="728" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="255" cy="260" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="259" cy="147" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="134" cy="112" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 138 789 L 255 260" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 255 260 L 259 147" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 259 147 L 134 112" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="138" cy="789" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="255" cy="260" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="259" cy="147" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="134" cy="112" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 121 851 L 255 260" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 255 260 L 259 147" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 259 147 L 134 112" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="121" cy="851" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="255" cy="260" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="259" cy="147" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="134" cy="112" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: With a tailwind you will have a chance to go directly onto the green. It's risky though, since missing the bounce on the island will lead to the water. Avoid this way unless you have straight tailwind. Also avoid going really short on the green. You won't be able to reach with your putt.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 211 651 L 149 221" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 149 221 L 140 100" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="211" cy="651" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="149" cy="221" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="140" cy="100" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 208 707 L 149 221" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 149 221 L 140 100" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="208" cy="707" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="149" cy="221" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="140" cy="100" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

levels.svg: <path d="M 219 763 L 149 221" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 149 221 L 140 100" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="219" cy="763" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="149" cy="221" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="140" cy="100" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: Without a good tailwind this is the way to go. Simple, safe drive in the fairway will leave you with a long or short iron to the pin.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 211 651 L 287 171" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 287 171 L 165 96" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="211" cy="651" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="287" cy="171" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="165" cy="96" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 208 707 L 287 171" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 287 171 L 165 96" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="208" cy="707" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="287" cy="171" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="165" cy="96" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 219 763 L 287 171" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 287 171 L 165 96" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="219" cy="763" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="287" cy="171" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="165" cy="96" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: This is a tricky drive that can easily end up in the rough or bunker. With a tailwind you may be able to go directly over or you can bounce it with 1 bar of backspin. Use the island to bounce your next shot onto the green. You could use the right fairway for your second shot but it will require a massive curl with sidespin to pull it off.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 217 800 L 143 334" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 143 334 L 91 126" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 91 126 L 95 80" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="217" cy="800" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="143" cy="334" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="91" cy="126" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="95" cy="80" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.svg: <path d="M 222 856 L 143 334" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 143 334 L 91 126" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 91 126 L 95 80" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="222" cy="856" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="143" cy="334" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="91" cy="126" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="95" cy="80" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 225 913 L 143 334" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 143 334 L 91 126" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 91 126 L 95 80" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="225" cy="913" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="143" cy="334" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="91" cy="126" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="95" cy="80" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: This is the safer and generally easier approach. Get as close to the end of the fairway as possible. You'll need to use some backspin on your drive because the fairway slopes down severely at the very end. That will leave you with a pretty straight shot into the green and a chance at an albatross.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 217 800 L 254 334" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 254 334 L 141 114" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 141 114 L 114 80" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="217" cy="800" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="254" cy="334" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="141" cy="114" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="114" cy="80" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 222 856 L 254 334" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 254 334 L 141 114" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 141 114 L 114 80" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="222" cy="856" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="254" cy="334" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="141" cy="114" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="114" cy="80" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 225 913 L 254 334" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 254 334 L 141 114" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 141 114 L 114 80" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="225" cy="913" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="254" cy="334" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="141" cy="114" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="114" cy="80" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: You can go with the black line and use a small amount of curl combined with some sidespin. You will need to use some backspin. From this side, you'll be using either a wood or a driver, depending on which tee you're playing from.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 149 540 C 191 343 191 343 189 183" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="149" cy="540" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="189" cy="183" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 144 604 C 191 343 191 343 189 183" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="144" cy="604" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="189" cy="183" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 140 669 C 191 343 191 343 189 183" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="140" cy="669" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="189" cy="183" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: If you have tailwind, this is the way to go. Use a wood with about 0.5 top spin to get it close. Just watch out for the rough and bunker in front.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 149 540 L 164 222" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="149" cy="540" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="164" cy="222" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 144 604 L 164 222" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="144" cy="604" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="164" cy="222" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 140 669 L 164 222" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="140" cy="669" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="164" cy="222" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: You'll need to use some curl and sidespin to get the ball close to the pin. It's recommended to only use this path if you get headwind mixed with some side wind coming from the left.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 149 540 C 105 365 105 365 139 186" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="149" cy="540" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="139" cy="186" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 144 604 C 105 365 105 365 139 186" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="144" cy="604" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="139" cy="186" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.svg: <path d="M 140 669 C 105 365 105 365 139 186" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="140" cy="669" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="139" cy="186" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

annotations.name: Green
annotations.svg:
<g class="guide-image-annotation">
  <circle cx="177" cy="127" r="4" fill="white" />
  <path d="M 290 290 L 177 127" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3"/>
  <image xlink:href="/img/golfclash/courses/WinterLinks/annotations/1-Green.png" x="215" y="215" width="150" height="150" />
</g>

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: This is the most common way to play the hole, out to the right. If you get a terrible headwind, bounce it before the rough over to the fairway. That will leave you with a wood to the green. Bounce it before the rough/bunker and be aware that it's uphill. Don't use that much backspin!

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 239 808 L 277 318" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 277 318 L 198 166" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 198 166 L 190 109" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="239" cy="808" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="277" cy="318" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="198" cy="166" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="190" cy="109" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 244 860 L 277 318" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 277 318 L 198 166" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 198 166 L 190 109" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="244" cy="860" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="277" cy="318" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="198" cy="166" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="190" cy="109" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 249 914 L 277 318" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 277 318 L 198 166" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 198 166 L 190 109" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="249" cy="914" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="277" cy="318" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="198" cy="166" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="190" cy="109" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: Take this route when you get a good tailwind. Go all in and get it to the big fairway after the rough. From there you should be able to use a short iron into the green.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 239 808 L 223 236" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 223 236 L 190 109" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="239" cy="808" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="223" cy="236" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="190" cy="109" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 244 860 L 223 236" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 223 236 L 190 109" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="244" cy="860" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="223" cy="236" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="190" cy="109" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 249 914 L 223 236" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 223 236 L 190 109" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="249" cy="914" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="223" cy="236" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="190" cy="109" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: A tricky way to play but if you're accurate enough you can bounce it over to the next fairway on the left. If you go long into the rough, you'll still be able to get to the green on your 2nd shot. Don't use max topspin on your drive as the second fairway is a bit downhill.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 239 808 L 164 403" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 164 403 L 136 271" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 136 271 L 190 109" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="239" cy="808" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="164" cy="403" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="136" cy="271" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="190" cy="109" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Pro

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: With tailwind you can bounce it over the creek from the fairway on the right with 4 - 5 bars of topspin. Be sure to get the second bounce in the rough so the ball will roll nicely onto the green for an easy putt. Some players will be able to play this way even with sidewind depending on the level of their driver.

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: This Par 3 is tricky because it's easy to get close but HARD to get an ace. The main adjustment is to go with 3 in topspin and 3 in LEFT sidespin. Combine that with a small amount of curl. That will get you on the right ball line to the pin and hopefully a hole in one.

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: On your drive, just avoid the bunker and rough on the left side. If you're using the Sniper, this path is the way to go for your 2nd shot. Go directly into the rough and let it roll out for a possible albatross.

guides.name: Red Path
guides.text: This is the suggested path when you're playing with the Guardian. Go directly onto the green with a good amount of backspin. Harder to albatross, but still an easy eagle.

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: This is the most common way to play the hole. Use 4 bars in topspin if you have tailwind, and max topspin if you have headwind. Land the second bounce in the rough close to the green and it will roll in nicely. Keep in mind this is a downhill teeshot so account for a little extra wind.

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: If your driver doesn't have much topspin you can overpower your shot and go directly into the rough. It will roll nicely out on the green.

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: Looking at this par 5 it may seem that you have 3 ways to play it but you'll only see 2 ways here because the 3rd way (off to the right) is so risky. You'll need a Titan on this hole to help yourself out. Use max sidespin combined with topspin and aim it at the sweet spot along the trees on the right. If you put your ball up close to the rough you'll need a wood club with a lot of curl. Use max curl, sidespin and 2 bars of topspin to get to the green and leave yourself a putt for eagle.

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: This is the normal way to play the hole. Use a decent amount of curl combined with max sidespin. With headwind, use 1 bar of backspin. With tailwind use 2 bars of backspin. Let it go up to the top and fall down to the pin for a possible hole in one.

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: Definitely a riskier way to play the hole. Curl it on the right side using 2 bars of topspin. You want to go up to the top of the green and let the ball fall back down.

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: This is a tricky Par 5. Skip the right side and NEVER play there. It may seem like a good option but your 2nd shot will be MUCH trickier even if your drive is perfect. Find the sweet spot on the small left fairway to bounce it over and between the 2 bunkers (Check Tommy's Video). From there you should be able to reach with your wood by bouncing over the rough and onto the green. If you can just get your ball onto the front edge, the green will let it roll down for an easy putt.

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: This is the way to go if you have straight tailwind or just a little bit of sidewind. Bounce it before the bunker and over to the fairway. From there you will find yourself with a long or short iron and a good chance for an eagle.

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: You can play your drive straight on this path but if you have curl on your driver, use it. Go with max curl and sidespin right. Be sure to stay away from the bunker in front. From the fairway, you'll be left with a wood into the green. Use your Sniper!

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: This is the way to go if you have a straight and strong tailwind. With a Big Dawg or Cataclysm you'll be able to get over the water to the green. Since you won't have that much backspin on those clubs, aim in the rough/bunker before the fairway starts. Use a good amount of topspin to get it to the green.

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: Without tailwind this is the way you'll need to play the hole. Put yourself in the fairway as close to the rough as possible and do the same for your second shot. For your third shot, you'll have a short iron to the pin. Use a maximum of 1 bar in backspin as the green is uphill and will make the ball stop faster than you may think.

resources.title: Tour 10 Shootout - Wind Pointed at 9 O`clock
Tour 8 Shootout - Strong Wind Pointed at 8 O`clock
Tour 8 Shootout - Strong Tailwind Pointed at 11 O`clock
Tour 8 Shootout - Strong Left to Right Wind
Tour 8 Shootout - Left to Right Wind

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: This is a fun Par 3 where you really need backspin. Aim between the bunkers with 4 bars of backspin with a long iron or almost max backspin with the Guardian. This is absolutely a big chance to make a hole in one, so be sharp with your adjustment. It's a downhill teeshot so your ball will be affected more by the wind.

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: There's really only one way to play this hole. Drive your ball up but NOT with max topspin. From there you can choose to bounce before the rough or go directly over the rough with your wood. Sniper and Guardian should give you the most success into the green.

Tour 8 Shootout - Headwind Pointed at 7 O`clock
Tour 8 Shootout - Left to Right Wind

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: It's a little tough to tell in the pictures, but you NEED to stay away from the left side of this green. Use a wood with a good ball guide and aim to the side of the bunker. The fairway is sloped in a way so the ball will bounce straight towards the pin. This is the preferred approach when faced with sidewind or headwind.

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: With tailwind go with this shot. Using the Guardian, or maxxed out Sniper, use maximum backspin and aim straight at the hole. It's slightly uphill before the green.

resources.title: Tour 8 - Layup Technique with Hard Wind

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: This is the common way to play the hole. Use sidespin and a small amount of curl (depending on the wind) to bounce over the rough and into the fairway. From there, aim for the rough just in front of the green. With a wood, use 0.5 in backspin and with a long iron use 2 in topspin. This will give you the best chance at an albatross. And of course, stay AWAY from the water!

levels.name: Rookie

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: With difficult wind, bounce before the rough on the left and land just before the bunker. From there, it's easier to bounce off the small island fairway and onto the green. Use between 1 and 2 in topspin for the second shot and use the back of the green to let the ball fall down towards the pin.

resources.title: Tour 10 Shootout - Wind Pointed at 9 O`clock
Tour 8 Shootout - Right to Left Wind
Tour 8 Shootout - Left to Right Wind

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: On this path there's a small flat surface that you can aim at with sidespin and a few bars of backspin. That will give a single bounce down to the green. It's very important to be accurate if you choose this way so you don't bounce into the left bunker.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 187 558 L 180 236" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="187" cy="558" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="180" cy="236" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: This is the easiest way to hit a flat surface, BUT also the easiest way to hit the rough or a bunker. Two bounces will land you near the pin.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 187 558 L 188 299" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="187" cy="558" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="188" cy="299" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.svg: <path d="M 186 636 L 188 299" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="186" cy="636" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="188" cy="299" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.svg: <path d="M 183 717 L 188 299" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="183" cy="717" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="188" cy="299" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: The preferred approach is to use max backspin, landing in the bowl between the two front bunkers. Using 2 bars of sidespin should get you close to the hole.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 187 558 L 211 223" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="187" cy="558" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="211" cy="223" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: This is the easiest and safest way to play the hole. Use backspin on your drive and put your ball just short of the rough on the right. From there, you'll have a wood into the green. Be sure to stay in the fairway because if you miss you won't be able to reach the green in two.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 167 801 L 322 407" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 322 407 L 203 122" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="167" cy="801" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="322" cy="407" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="203" cy="122" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: If you get straight tailwind, this is the way to go. Not recommended otherwise. Bounce just after the water with max topspin and put yourself into the rough. If you're lucky you may be able to get it out to the fairway. That will leave you with a short iron into the green.

resources.title: Tour 8 - Strategy and Tips with Headwind

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: From the first tee you can go easy and just focus on landing in the fairway or go for maximum distance. The fairway is pretty wide and you'll be able to reach the green from the rough with a long drive.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 414 814 L 274 309" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 274 309 L 135 132" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="414" cy="814" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="274" cy="309" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="135" cy="132" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: With tailwind pull out a Titan or Berserker with max topspin, sidespin and curl. Go all in and get as far as possible which should land you close to the green. If you get headwind or sidewind, use half curl and sidespin left to leave yourself with a long or short iron to the pin.

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 191 811 C 280 506 280 506 231 283" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 231 283 L 135 132" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="191" cy="811" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="231" cy="283" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="135" cy="132" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

resources.title: Tour 11 Shootout - Wind Pointed at 9 O'oclock
Tour 11 Shootout - Strong Wind Pointed at 8-9 O'clock
Tour 11 Shootout - Left to Right Wind
Tour 11 Shootout - Right to Left Cross Wind
Tour 11 Shootout - Left to Right Wind
Tour 9 Shootout - Tailwind Pointed Near 12 O`clock

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: Bounce your teeshot between the bunkers with 2 bars of backspin with headwind and 2.5 - 3 bars of backspin with a tailwind. Easiest approach from the second tee.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 162 581 L 178 222" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="162" cy="581" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="178" cy="222" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 161 657 L 178 222" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="161" cy="657" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="178" cy="222" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 159 727 L 178 222" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="159" cy="727" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="178" cy="222" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: Land your teeshot in the rough just beyond the bunker with 1.5 in backspin to get your ball to roll down to to he hole. Easiest approach from the first tee.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 162 581 L 172 159" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="162" cy="581" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="172" cy="159" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 161 657 L 172 159" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="161" cy="657" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="172" cy="159" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 159 727 L 172 159" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="159" cy="727" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="172" cy="159" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: A challenging and risky way to play the hole. A wood club with a lot of backspin is preferred. Use curl and backspin to get it close.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 162 581 C 120 354 120 354 154 167" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="162" cy="581" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="154" cy="167" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 161 657 C 120 354 120 354 154 167" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="161" cy="657" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="154" cy="167" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 159 727 C 120 354 120 354 154 167" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="159" cy="727" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="154" cy="167" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: This is the normal way to play this hole. Using curl, topspin and sidepin put your ball as close to the top of the fairway as possible. That will leave you with a short iron to the green.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 206 677 L 250 284" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 250 284 L 211 152" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 211 152 L 169 80" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="206" cy="677" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="250" cy="284" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="211" cy="152" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="169" cy="80" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Pro

levels.name: Masters

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: This path is only an option with a tailwind of at least 7 with a Berserker and 8 - 10 with a Titan or Kingmaker. Go all in and make sure to land the bounce on the small fairway. Land the second bounce in the rough before the green to slow the ball onto the green.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 206 677 C 133 427 133 427 143 221" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 143 221 L 151 80" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="206" cy="677" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="143" cy="221" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="151" cy="80" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 201 730 C 133 427 133 427 143 221" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 143 221 L 151 80" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="201" cy="730" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="143" cy="221" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="151" cy="80" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: Normal way to play the hole. With head or sidewind place your drive as close to the end of the fairway as possible. Use curl on your second shot and go directly over to the next fairway or you can use the smaller fairway to bounce over. If you get enough tailwind you can try to bounce your drive just shy of the bunker and use a lot of topspin to bounce to the third fairway platform. Birdie hole in general.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 325 851 L 146 452" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 146 452 C 127 303 127 303 182 183" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 182 183 L 335 97" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="325" cy="851" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="146" cy="452" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="182" cy="183" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="335" cy="97" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: Play the same drive as you would in the other approach. For your second shot you play into the small fairway way off on the right. From there you can hit the green. This is a decent option if your drive goes too short.

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: The normal way to play the hole. Bounce before the rough on the right and you'll have a short iron left for your second shot. Big chance for an eagle!

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: With tailwind, you have a possibility to make the green in one. You'll need to use a Titan or Berserker depending on how good the tailwind is. Use a slight amount of curl with some left sidepin. Use the rough to slow the ball onto the green.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 211 701 C 293 417 293 417 282 232" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 282 232 L 239 135" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="211" cy="701" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="282" cy="232" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="239" cy="135" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 220 820 C 293 417 293 417 282 232" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 282 232 L 239 135" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="220" cy="820" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="282" cy="232" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="239" cy="135" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: Use the fairway platform to bounce over to the green and let the ball roll out to the pin. Important to only use 1 bar of backspin with tailwind and half a bar of topspin with headwind. Recommended approach with head or tailwind.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 162 556 L 158 242" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 158 242 L 163 151" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="162" cy="556" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="158" cy="242" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="163" cy="151" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

levels.svg: <path d="M 164 643 L 158 242" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 158 242 L 163 151" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="164" cy="643" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="158" cy="242" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="163" cy="151" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: There is a big piece of rough you can hit into using this approach. Use 2 bars of topspin with headwind and 1 bar of topspin with a tailwind. A nice way to play the hole with sidewind.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 162 556 L 172 176" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="162" cy="556" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="172" cy="176" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: This is the recommended way for most cases. The risk is putting it in the water if you misjudge a headwind or tailwind. 1 bar of backspin is the normal adjustment.

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: This is an approach mostly used from the second tee. Use a Quarterback or a MAXED Rocket to get some really good backspin. Use almost max backspin to take the water out of play. Keep in mind that max backspin can result in some much different bounces than normal.

resources.title: Tour 9 - Shot Over the Water Tips

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: This may seem like an easy Par 4 but demands all the backspin you can get. Change your bag so you have all clubs with a lot of backspin. Don't forget your rough iron. The pin sits on the front edge of the green so you won't be able to chip it in with less than 8 bars of backspin. Stay away from the water!

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 223 654 L 255 213" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 255 213 L 200 106" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="223" cy="654" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="255" cy="213" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="200" cy="106" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 220 707 L 255 213" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 255 213 L 200 106" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="220" cy="707" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="255" cy="213" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="200" cy="106" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

levels.svg: <path d="M 216 763 L 255 213" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 255 213 L 200 106" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="216" cy="763" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="255" cy="213" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="200" cy="106" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: A really hard Par 5 which leaves no room for mistakes. Use plenty of curl on your drive combined with all the left spin your ball can give. DON'T use too much topspin which can cause your ball to roll through the fairway and into the rough or bunker. Second shot requires a wood with length. Bounce your ball over the rough patch to make it stay on the green. Don't go for the albatross. Rather, put yourself safely on the green for an eagle instead of bringing the bunker on the left into play.

resources.title: Tour 9 - Strategy and Tips Laying Up
Tour 9 - Tips and Strategies for Eagle

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: This is a very long Par 5 which will require you to bring your A-game. Put your drive up as close to the end of the first fairway as possible. You'll still be left with a hard shot to reach the green in two. If you have the wind, you can bounce your second shot over the bunker or you can land your ball directly in the rough with a lot of topspin and let it release onto the green. Either way is a difficult shot to pull off.

resources.title: Tour 7 Shootout - Wind Pointed at 1 O`clock

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: An excellent chance at a hole in one. You should hit the fairway just before the bunker to get the second bounce on the fringe. Use 2 - 2.5 bars of backspin and the ball should release right to the hole.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 148 536 L 182 237" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="148" cy="536" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="182" cy="237" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 150 613 L 182 237" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="150" cy="613" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="182" cy="237" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 153 694 L 182 237" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="153" cy="694" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="182" cy="237" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: Using a wood (Pro / Expert) or long iron (Rookie) with a lot of backspin you can take this path. You'll also need to add a bit of curl to get it close to the pin. If you closely watch the green you will see that if you bounce within 10 yards of the pin, the green will help keep your ball on the green.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 148 536 C 106 375 106 375 163 205" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="148" cy="536" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="163" cy="205" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 150 613 C 106 375 106 375 163 205" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="150" cy="613" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="163" cy="205" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 153 694 C 106 375 106 375 163 205" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="153" cy="694" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="163" cy="205" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: Play your driver straight up to give yourself a straight and open second shot to the green. When you approach the green, you will need 2 - 4 bars of backspin. This is one that you can definitely put in for an eagle. Missing left or right though can land you in a bunker.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 196 707 L 276 275" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 276 275 L 108 111" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="196" cy="707" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="276" cy="275" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="108" cy="111" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 193 758 L 276 275" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 276 275 L 108 111" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="193" cy="758" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="276" cy="275" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="108" cy="111" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 189 810 L 276 275" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 276 275 L 108 111" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="189" cy="810" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="276" cy="275" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="108" cy="111" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: Bounce your drive over the small strip of rough. Don't use too much topspin to avoid rolling through the fairway. Hitting the green with a rough iron is much more difficult.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 196 707 L 202 267" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 202 267 L 107 116" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="196" cy="707" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="202" cy="267" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="107" cy="116" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 193 758 L 202 267" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 202 267 L 107 116" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="193" cy="758" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="202" cy="267" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="107" cy="116" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />
