guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: What may seem like a boring way to play the hole is actually the best way to get a good eagle opportunity. No matter what kind of wind you get, use max overpower on your drive and then again use max overpower with your rough iron on your second shot. That should leave you with a long or short iron to the green. Be sure to use the driver with the most distance and rough iron with the most topspin.

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: With tailwind or a tail/sidewind, you can go over the rough. Try to bounce just after the rough and roll down the fairway. This will leave a good opportunity for an albatross but at least an easy eagle.

resources.title: Tour 9 Shootout - Wind Pointed at 5 O'clock
Tour 11 Shootout - Wind Pointed at 4 O'clock
Tour 11 Shootout - Wind Pointed at 4 O'clock

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: There's really only one way to play this hole, going up through the narrow fairway. Use 2 bars of backspin with the driver and no bars using your wood. Use up to 5 bars of right side spin depending on what ball you're using. You want the ball to roll to the back of the green and fall back toward the pin.

holes.description: BEWARE! The green slopes severely right to left so keep your approach shot to the right!

resources.title: Tour 11 Shootout - Tips to Getting Eagle Pitch

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: This is a tough hole. With headwind or sidewind going left is the best way to go. Use full topspin and some left sidespin with your drive. You want to get as close to the rough as possible but NOT in it. That will leave you with a wood into the green. You'll need a wood with plenty of distance.

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: Only play this path with tailwind and you can go directly over the creek. Use max topspin to get as far up the fairway as possible. That will likely leave you with a short iron for your second shot.

guides.name: Blue Path
guides.text: This is a riskier route where you aim between the bunkers and use a good amount of topspin to get over to the next fairway. You'll need at least 5 bars of topspin to pull it off. You'll have a short or long iron into the green.

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: This is a very tough par 5 to get an eagle on. If you DON'T have tailwind play the black path. Bounce your drive over the sliver of rough to the small fairway on the left. From there, depending on the wind, you can either bounce on the next small fairway to the last fairway or use a lot of backspin to hold your second shot on that small fairway. That will leave you with a difficult approach into the green. It's important to just keep your ball on the green. Avoid using too much backspin or you may end up in the front greenside bunker.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 308 940 L 191 613" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 191 613 L 131 484" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 131 484 L 181 286" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <path d="M 181 286 L 248 87" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="3" /> <circle cx="308" cy="940" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="191" cy="613" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="131" cy="484" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="181" cy="286" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" /> <circle cx="248" cy="87" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="4" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 310 978 L 191 613" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 191 613 L 131 484" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 131 484 L 181 286" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <path d="M 181 286 L 248 87" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="3" /> <circle cx="310" cy="978" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="191" cy="613" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="131" cy="484" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="181" cy="286" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" /> <circle cx="248" cy="87" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="4" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 312 1016 L 191 613" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 191 613 L 131 484" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 131 484 L 181 286" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <path d="M 181 286 L 248 87" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="3" /> <circle cx="312" cy="1016" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="191" cy="613" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="131" cy="484" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="181" cy="286" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" /> <circle cx="248" cy="87" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="4" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: With tailwind, go ALL IN and get as far down the fairway as possible. Use the driver with the most distance. For the second shot, you'll need a wood with a lot of distance to make the green in two. You can go left or right with the second shot and let the ball roll down to the pin.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 308 940 L 287 468" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 287 468 L 284 326" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 284 326 C 232 205 232 205 252 91" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="308" cy="940" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="287" cy="468" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="284" cy="326" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="252" cy="91" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 310 978 L 287 468" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 287 468 L 284 326" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 284 326 C 232 205 232 205 252 91" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="310" cy="978" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="287" cy="468" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="284" cy="326" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="252" cy="91" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

resources.title: Tour 11 Shootout - Hard Left to Right Wind Tips
Tour 11 Shootout - Right to Left Wind
Tour 11 Shootout - Wind Pointed at 9 O'clock

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: This is the path to take with headwind or if you're using a driver without a lot of curl. Use 1-2 bars of topspin and max left sidespin. Bounce over the rough and your ball should feed right down towards the pin.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 383 818 C 445 527 445 527 450 328" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="383" cy="818" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="450" cy="328" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 380 901 C 445 527 445 527 450 328" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="380" cy="901" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="450" cy="328" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 378 987 C 445 527 445 527 450 328" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="378" cy="987" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="450" cy="328" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: With sidewind or tailwind this is the best way to play the hole. Use 4+ backspin along with max left sidespin. With straight tailwind, use about 50% left curl and with a right to left wind you still should not use max curl.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 383 818 C 501 503 501 503 460 243" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="383" cy="818" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="460" cy="243" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 380 901 C 501 503 501 503 460 243" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="380" cy="901" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="460" cy="243" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 378 987 C 501 503 501 503 460 243" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="378" cy="987" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="460" cy="243" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: Blue Path
guides.text: This may be a better option when you get a wind from left to right. Use max right sidespin with 1 - 3 bars of backspin. Bounce over the water and down to the pin.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 383 818 C 258 485 258 485 307 295" stroke="blue" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="383" cy="818" r="6" fill="blue" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="307" cy="295" r="6" fill="blue" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 380 901 C 258 485 258 485 307 295" stroke="blue" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="380" cy="901" r="6" fill="blue" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="307" cy="295" r="6" fill="blue" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 378 987 C 258 485 258 485 307 295" stroke="blue" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="378" cy="987" r="6" fill="blue" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="307" cy="295" r="6" fill="blue" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: This is generally only an option in the Rookie division where winds are low. Place your first bounce on the island and let the ball run out towards the pin. Keep in mind that the bounce on the island is inconsistent and unreliable.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 383 818 L 388 303" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="383" cy="818" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="388" cy="303" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 380 901 L 388 303" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="380" cy="901" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="388" cy="303" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

resources.title: Tour 10 Shootout - Hard Tailwind Pointed at 1 O`clock
Tour 10 Shootout - Hard Tailwind Pointed at 1 O`clock
Tour 10 Shootout - Strong Wind Pointed at 5 O`clock
Tour 10 Shootout - Wind Pointed at 2 O`clock
Tour 10 Shootout - Left to Right Wind

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: You can go with the black line and use a small amount of curl combined with some sidespin. You will need to use some backspin. From this side, you'll be using either a wood or a driver, depending on which tee you're playing from.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 179 551 C 229 320 229 320 205 183" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="179" cy="551" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="205" cy="183" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 176 620 C 229 320 229 320 205 183" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="176" cy="620" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="205" cy="183" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 173 690 C 229 320 229 320 205 183" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="173" cy="690" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="205" cy="183" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: If you have tailwind, this is the way to go. Use a wood with about 0.5 top spin to get it close. Just watch out for the rough and bunker in front.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 179 551 L 178 229" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="179" cy="551" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="178" cy="229" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 176 620 L 178 229" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="176" cy="620" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="178" cy="229" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 173 690 L 178 229" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="173" cy="690" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="178" cy="229" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: You'll need to use some curl and sidespin to get the ball close to the pin. It's recommended to only use this path if you get headwind mixed with some side wind coming from the left.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 179 551 C 107 329 107 329 154 186" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="179" cy="551" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="154" cy="186" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 176 620 C 107 329 107 329 154 186" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="176" cy="620" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="154" cy="186" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 173 690 C 107 329 107 329 154 186" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="173" cy="690" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="154" cy="186" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: With tailwind you can bounce it over the creek from the fairway on the right with 4 - 5 bars of topspin. Be sure to get the second bounce in the rough so the ball will roll nicely onto the green for an easy putt. Some players will be able to play this way even with sidewind depending on the level of their driver.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 255 682 C 325 470 325 470 328 276" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 328 276 L 324 185" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 324 185 L 318 165" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="255" cy="682" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="328" cy="276" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="324" cy="185" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="318" cy="165" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 268 731 C 325 470 325 470 328 276" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 328 276 L 324 185" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 324 185 L 318 165" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="268" cy="731" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="328" cy="276" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="324" cy="185" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="318" cy="165" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 282 782 C 325 470 325 470 328 276" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 328 276 L 324 185" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 324 185 L 318 165" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="282" cy="782" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="328" cy="276" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="324" cy="185" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="318" cy="165" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: Without tailwind, this is the way to go. Get over to the fairway and leave yourself with a short iron for the eagle.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 255 682 L 229 270" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 229 270 L 300 160" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="255" cy="682" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="229" cy="270" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="300" cy="160" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 268 731 L 229 270" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 229 270 L 300 160" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="268" cy="731" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="229" cy="270" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="300" cy="160" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 282 782 L 229 270" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 229 270 L 300 160" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="282" cy="782" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="229" cy="270" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="300" cy="160" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

resources.title: Tour 9 Shootout - Wind Pointed at 11 O`clock
Tour 10 Shootout - Wind Pointed at 8 O`clock
Tour 10 Shootout - Wind Pointed at 9 O`clock

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: This is the normal way to play the hole. Use a decent amount of curl combined with max sidespin. With headwind, use 1 bar of backspin. With tailwind use 2 bars of backspin. Let it go up to the top and fall down to the pin for a possible hole in one.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 246 603 C 120 391 120 391 135 173" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="246" cy="603" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="135" cy="173" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 250 677 C 120 391 120 391 135 173" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="250" cy="677" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="135" cy="173" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 252 755 C 120 391 120 391 135 173" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="252" cy="755" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="135" cy="173" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: Definitely a riskier way to play the hole. Curl it on the right side using 2 bars of topspin. You want to go up to the top of the green and let the ball fall back down.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 246 603 C 311 382 311 382 286 237" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="246" cy="603" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="286" cy="237" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 250 677 C 311 382 311 382 286 237" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="250" cy="677" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="286" cy="237" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 252 755 C 311 382 311 382 286 237" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="252" cy="755" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="286" cy="237" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: This is the most common way to play the hole, out to the right. If you get a terrible headwind, bounce it before the rough over to the fairway. That will leave you with a wood to the green. Bounce it before the rough/bunker and be aware that it's uphill. Don't use that much backspin!

levels.name: Rookie

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: Take this route when you get a good tailwind. Go all in and get it to the big fairway after the rough. From there you should be able to use a short iron into the green.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 200 808 L 229 240" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 229 240 L 201 121" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="200" cy="808" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="229" cy="240" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="201" cy="121" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: A tricky way to play but if you're accurate enough you can bounce it over to the next fairway on the left. If you go long into the rough, you'll still be able to get to the green on your 2nd shot. Don't use max topspin on your drive as the second fairway is a bit downhill.

resources.title: Tour 9 Shootout - Wind Pointed at 10 O`clock
Tour 10 Shootout - Left to Right Wind Strategy and Tips

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: This Par 3 is tricky because it's easy to get close but HARD to get an ace. The main adjustment is to go with 3 in topspin and 3 in LEFT sidespin. Combine that with a small amount of curl. That will get you on the right ball line to the pin and hopefully a hole in one.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 424 755 C 200 521 200 521 187 218" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="424" cy="755" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="187" cy="218" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: This is a tricky Par 5. Skip the right side and NEVER play there. It may seem like a good option but your 2nd shot will be MUCH trickier even if your drive is perfect. Find the sweet spot on the small left fairway to bounce it over and between the 2 bunkers (Check Tommy's Video). From there you should be able to reach with your wood by bouncing over the rough and onto the green. If you can just get your ball onto the front edge, the green will let it roll down for an easy putt.

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: On your drive, just avoid the bunker and rough on the left side. If you're using the Sniper, this path is the way to go for your 2nd shot. Go directly into the rough and let it roll out for a possible albatross.

guides.name: Red Path
guides.text: This is the suggested path when you're playing with the Guardian. Go directly onto the green with a good amount of backspin. Harder to albatross, but still an easy eagle.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 265 844 C 304 553 304 553 272 280" stroke="red" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 272 280 L 399 93" stroke="red" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="265" cy="844" r="6" fill="red" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="272" cy="280" r="6" fill="red" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="399" cy="93" r="6" fill="red" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: This is the most common way to play the hole. Use 4 bars in topspin if you have tailwind, and max topspin if you have headwind. Land the second bounce in the rough close to the green and it will roll in nicely. Keep in mind this is a downhill teeshot so account for a little extra wind.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 205 591 L 158 268" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 158 268 L 151 153" stroke="black" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="205" cy="591" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="158" cy="268" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="151" cy="153" r="6" fill="black" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: If your driver doesn't have much topspin you can overpower your shot and go directly into the rough. It will roll nicely out on the green.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 205 591 L 165 167" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="205" cy="591" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="165" cy="167" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: Black Path
guides.text: Looking at this par 5 it may seem that you have 3 ways to play it but you'll only see 2 ways here because the 3rd way (off to the right) is so risky. You'll need a Titan on this hole to help yourself out. Use max sidespin combined with topspin and aim it at the sweet spot along the trees on the right. If you put your ball up close to the rough you'll need a wood club with a lot of curl. Use max curl, sidespin and 2 bars of topspin to get to the green and leave yourself a putt for eagle.

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: The drive here is the same as the black path. The only difference is to take your 2nd shot up over the trees if you come up a little short on your drive.

levels.name: Rookie

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: Use the fairway platform to bounce over to the green and let the ball roll out to the pin. Important to only use 1 bar of backspin with tailwind and half a bar of topspin with headwind. Recommended approach with head or tailwind.

levels.svg: <path d="M 164 579 L 155 265" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 155 265 L 157 185" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="164" cy="579" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="155" cy="265" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="157" cy="185" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: There is a big piece of rough you can hit into using this approach. Use 2 bars of topspin with headwind and 1 bar of topspin with a tailwind. A nice way to play the hole with sidewind.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 164 579 L 165 202" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="164" cy="579" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="165" cy="202" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: Normal way to play the hole. With head or sidewind place your drive as close to the end of the fairway as possible. Use curl on your second shot and go directly over to the next fairway or you can use the smaller fairway to bounce over. If you get enough tailwind you can try to bounce your drive just shy of the bunker and use a lot of topspin to bounce to the third fairway platform. Birdie hole in general.

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: Play the same drive as you would in the other approach. For your second shot you play into the small fairway way off on the right. From there you can hit the green. This is a decent option if your drive goes too short.

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: Bounce your teeshot between the bunkers with 2 bars of backspin with headwind and 2.5 - 3 bars of backspin with a tailwind. Easiest approach from the second tee.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 174 614 L 200 254" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="174" cy="614" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="200" cy="254" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: Land your teeshot in the rough just beyond the bunker with 1.5 in backspin to get your ball to roll down to to he hole. Easiest approach from the first tee.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 174 614 L 192 191" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="174" cy="614" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="192" cy="191" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: Red Path
guides.text: A challenging and risky way to play the hole. A wood club with a lot of backspin is preferred. Use curl and backspin to get it close.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 174 614 C 131 371 131 371 171 198" stroke="red" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="174" cy="614" r="6" fill="red" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="171" cy="198" r="6" fill="red" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Pro
levels.svg: <path d="M 171 692 C 131 371 131 371 171 198" stroke="red" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="171" cy="692" r="6" fill="red" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="171" cy="198" r="6" fill="red" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

levels.name: Masters
levels.svg: <path d="M 166 765 C 131 371 131 371 171 198" stroke="red" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="166" cy="765" r="6" fill="red" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="171" cy="198" r="6" fill="red" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: A really hard Par 5 which leaves no room for mistakes. Use plenty of curl on your drive combined with all the left spin your ball can give. DON'T use too much topspin which can cause your ball to roll through the fairway and into the rough or bunker. Second shot requires a wood with length. Bounce your ball over the rough patch to make it stay on the green. Don't go for the albatross. Rather, put yourself safely on the green for an eagle instead of bringing the bunker on the left into play.

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: This is the normal way to play this hole. Using curl, topspin and sidepin put your ball as close to the top of the fairway as possible. That will leave you with a short iron to the green.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 197 754 L 250 364" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 250 364 L 218 222" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <path d="M 218 222 L 173 155" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="197" cy="754" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="250" cy="364" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="218" cy="222" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" /> <circle cx="173" cy="155" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="3" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: This path is only an option with a tailwind of at least 7 with a Berserker and 8 - 10 with a Titan or Kingmaker. Go all in and make sure to land the bounce on the small fairway. Land the second bounce in the rough before the green to slow the ball onto the green.

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 197 754 C 124 497 124 497 148 292" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 148 292 L 155 157" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="197" cy="754" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="148" cy="292" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="155" cy="157" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: The normal way to play the hole. Bounce before the rough on the right and you'll have a short iron left for your second shot. Big chance for an eagle!

levels.name: Rookie
levels.svg: <path d="M 232 707 C 133 436 133 436 166 247" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <path d="M 166 247 L 212 140" stroke="yellow" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="232" cy="707" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="166" cy="247" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" /> <circle cx="212" cy="140" r="6" fill="yellow" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="2" />

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: With tailwind, you have a possibility to make the green in one. You'll need to use a Titan or Berserker depending on how good the tailwind is. Use a slight amount of curl with some left sidepin. Use the rough to slow the ball onto the green.

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: This is the recommended way for most cases. The risk is putting it in the water if you misjudge a headwind or tailwind. 1 bar of backspin is the normal adjustment.

levels.name: Rookie

guides.name: White Path
guides.text: This is an approach mostly used from the second tee. Use a Quarterback or a MAXED Rocket to get some really good backspin. Use almost max backspin to take the water out of play. Keep in mind that max backspin can result in some much different bounces than normal.

levels.svg: <path d="M 157 755 C 240 321 240 321 205 143" stroke="white" fill="transparent" stroke-width="3" class="guide-path" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="157" cy="755" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="0" /> <circle cx="205" cy="143" r="6" fill="white" class="guide-point" data-guide-segment="1" />

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: This may seem like an easy Par 4 but demands all the backspin you can get. Change your bag so you have all clubs with a lot of backspin. Don't forget your rough iron. The pin sits on the front edge of the green so you won't be able to chip it in with less than 8 bars of backspin. Stay away from the water!

guides.name: Yellow Path
guides.text: This is a very long Par 5 which will require you to bring your A-game. Put your drive up as close to the end of the first fairway as possible. You'll still be left with a hard shot to reach the green in two. If you have the wind, you can bounce your second shot over the bunker or you can land your ball directly in the rough with a lot of topspin and let it release onto the green. Either way is a difficult shot to pull off.
